template_id.value: MEDTRONIC VBHC CRC Clinical Outcomes Follow-up

template.concept: MEDTRONIC VBHC CRC Clinical Outcomes Follow-up

term_definitions.items: Provides extra information about the encounter context, regarding the internal cases used at Pathfinder for encounter types and reasons, along with an appointment and encounter id. Terminology should be loaded from the Think!EHR terminology adapter.
Unique identifier for each appointment process.
Unique identifier for each encounter process.
Type of encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
Reason for encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
The speciality of the author/composer of the document.
A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain.
For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.
for example: Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
A term specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.
Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
A term defining the healthcare facility type.
Coded text is preferred. The codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed.
For example: Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology. Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Additional metadata about the document itself, including size, url.
This list of codes represents the main clinical acts.
Research information for the cancer registries from Medtronic VBHC IHU.
Name of the cohort/study for the registry.
Moment of the assessment, baseline, follow up.
Plan or sequence of discrete activities developed to achieve a specified management goal or treatment outcome, carried out by health professionals and/or the patient.
Need for a care plan has been identified.
Care plan activities commenced and in progress.
Care plan components identified and documented.
Care plan duration has passed the 'Expiry Date'.
All activities related to the care plan have been reconciled or completed.
Anticipated date beyond which the care plan can be deemed 'expired'.
Description of activity performed/enacted against the plan.
Reason for activity being performed /enacted against the plan.
Care plan has been cancelled prior to commencement.
Commencement of care plan has been temporarily postponed to a future date.
Care plan is temporarily suspended but intended to resume at a later date.
Indicate whether the patient received one of the following treatment during the last year
A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.
Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.

Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.
Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.
For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.
For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.

Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.
The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.
Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.
Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.
Identification of the body site for the procedure.

Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.

Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.
Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.
This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.
Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.
An ongoing and persistent overview about medical devices that have been fitted or implanted.
Assertion about the fitting or implanting of devices, as at the date 'Last updated'.
The device type has never been fitted or implanted.
The device type is currently fitted or implanted.
The device type has been fitted or implanted in the past.
Identification of the specific device, by name.
Date of fitting or implant of the device.
Date when the device stopped being used or was removed.
Additional structured detail about the device.
Identification of the body site where the device is fitted/implanted.
A structured anatomical location of the body site where the device is fitted/implanted.
Narrative description about the use of the fitted device type.
The date this summary was last updated.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Date on which this device should be reviewed.
Name of the type of medical device.
For example: Assisted hearing devices, eyeglasses, contact lens, dental braces, dentures, orthotics or artificial limbs.
Digital image, video or diagram about the device.
Link to the original data about the fitting or insertion.
Commonly, this will be an ACTION archetype that contains the details about the fitting or insertion of the device.
A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.
Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.

For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.

This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.

item.list: Complication related to colorectal cancer treatment

term_definitions.items: Complications while or 90 days after initiation of treatment
Indicate whether the patient experienced a complication while on treatment or up to 90 days after initiation of treatment.
To record the type of complication
Complication related to colorectal cancer treatment
Indicate whether the complication is attributable to colorectal cancer treatment.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Details of person's death aligned with PARENT Common Data Elements for registry use.
The date of the subject's death.
Was the death due to the primary diagnosis?
Ther current administrative gender of the person.
The sex of the person at birth.
Whether the patient is alive or dead.
The age of the person. This may be calculated.
Details of tumour involvement at margins of surgical resections/biopsies.
Evidence of tumour at a surgical resection margin.
Details where tumour is present at the surgical resection margin.
When tumour is present at surgical resection margin, the maximal length of involvement.
Details where tumour is absent from surgical resection margins.
When tumour is absent, the distance from tumour to the closest surgical resection margin.
A text description of tumour involvement at the surgical resection margin.
Tumour is present at the surgical resection margin.
Tumour is absent from the surgical resection margin.
Presence of tumour at surgical resection margins has not been determined.
Presence of tumour at the surgical resection margin is equivocal.
The name of the margin being described e.g. Deep margin, Vascular margin, Bronchial margin.
The location of the margin being described.
The nature of involvement of the tumour with the surgical margin.
Indicate whether there is a complete response

In case of pathologic evaluation: a pathologic complete response is defined as no evidence of residual invasive cancer of the complete resected specimen and all sampled regional lymph nodes. In case of diagnostic evaluation only: a clinical complete response is defined when there is no sign of tumor after all diagnostic tests (e.g. MRI/endoscopy) .
Indicate whether there is evidence of local, regional or distant recurrence.
Indicate whether there is evidence of disease progression.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Indicate where patient died as indicated on certificate of death.
Was patient cared by hospice at time of death?
Indicate whether the preference for place of death was documented (the most recent documented place of death)
Date of documentation of desired place of death
Hospital readmission > 1 time during the last 30 days of life (excluding emergency consultations)
Indicate whether the patient was admitted to the hospital > 1 time in the last 30 days of life.
Emergency visits should not be included.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.

template_id.value: MEDTRONIC VBHC CRC Clinical Outcomes Follow-up

term_definitions.items: MEDTRONIC VBHC CRC Clinical Outcomes Follow-up
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

items.items: MEDTRONIC VBHC CRC Clinical Outcomes Follow-up
Interaction, contact ou vnement de soins entre un sujet de soins et un ou des prestataires de soins.
Informations supplmentaires requises pour saisir le contexte local ou pour s'aligner sur d'autres modles/formalismes de rfrence.
Par exemple: les informations sur les services hospitaliers locaux ou des mtadonnes supplmentaires pour s'aligner sur les quivalents FHIR ou CIMI.

Fournit des informations supplmentaires sur le contexte de la rencontre, concernant les cas internes utiliss par Pathfinder pour les types et les raisons de la rencontre, ainsi qu'un rendez-vous et un numro d'identification de la rencontre. La terminologie doit tre charge partir de l'adaptateur terminologique de Think!EHR.
Identifiant unique pour chaque processus de rendez-vous.
Identifiant unique pour chaque processus de rencontre.
Type de rencontre, doit tre fourni par le serveur de terminologie.
Raison de la rencontre, doit tre fournie par le serveur de terminologie.
Mtadonnes de composition supplmentaires alignes sur l'IHE-XDS qui ne sont pas dj disponibles dans la classe COMPOSITION du modle de rfrence.
La spcialit de l'auteur/compositeur du document.
Un code de classe de document de haut niveau, normalement slectionn partir d'un ensemble de valeurs fournies par le domaine d'affinit IHE-XDS.
Par exemple : Rapport, Rsum, Images, Plan, Prfrences du patient, Workflow. Ces codes sont spcifiques un domaine d'affinit XDS.

Le code spcifiant le type prcis de document du point de vue de l'utilisateur. Normalement slectionn partir d'un ensemble de valeurs fournies par le domaine d'affinit local de l'IHE-XDS ou la norme nationale.
Par exemple : Historique pulmonaire et physique, rsum de dcharge, rapport d'chographie. Ces codes sont spcifiques un domaine d'affinit XDS. (en)
Terme prcisant le niveau de confidentialit du document XDS.
Le texte cod est prfr, normalement spcifique un domaine d'affinit XDS.
Terme dfinissant le type d'tablissement de soin.
Le texte cod est prfrable. Les codes sont spcifiques un domaine d'affinit XDS.
Le code prcisant la spcialit clinique o l'acte qui a donn lieu au document a t faite.
Par exemple : Pratique familiale, laboratoire, radiologie. Le texte cod est prfr, normalement spcifique un domaine d'affinit XDS.
Mtadonnes supplmentaires sur le document lui-mme, y compris la taille, l'url.
Cette liste de codes reprsente les principaux actes cliniques.

Utiliser pour saisir des informations dtailles et structures sur l'emplacement anatomique, la mthode et la technique, l'quipement utilis, les dispositifs implants, les rsultats, les constatations, etc.

Utilisez cet lment de donnes pour enregistrer des termes simples ou des complications prcoordonnes. Si les exigences en matire d'enregistrement des complications sont plus complexes, il est conseill d'utiliser un archtype CLUSTER spcifique dans l'espace "Dtail de la procdure" de cet archtype et cet lment de donnes devient redondant. Exemples : Hmaturie aprs une biopsie rnale, irritation des tissus aprs l'insertion d'un cathter intraveineux.

Envoi de la demande de procdure.

*For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure. (en)
Cette tape a t dprcie car elle a t incorrectement associe au statut "initiale" - utilisez la nouvelle tape "Procdure planifie" (at0004) qui est correctement associe au statut "planifi".
*(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.) (en)
X - Envoi de la demande de procdure
Cette tape a t dprcie car elle a t incorrectement associe au statut "initiale" - utilisez la nouvelle tape "Demande de procdure envoye" (at0007) qui est correctement associe au statut "planifi".
La procdure planifie a t annule avant le dbut.
La procdure a t ralise et toutes les activits cliniques associes ont t acheves.
La procdure, ou la sous-procdure dans une procdure plusieurs composantes, a t ralise.
Le rsultat de la procdure a t excut.

Description narrative de la procdure, en fonction de l'tape du parcours.
Par exemple : description de l'excution et des rsultats de la procdure, de la tentative avorte ou de l'annulation de la procdure.
L'identifiant local attribu l'ordre par le prestataire de soins ou l'organisation qui demande le service.
C'est l'quivalent du numro d'ordre du placeur dans les spcifications HL7 v2.
Des informations sur le prestataire de soins ou l'organisation qui demande le service.
L'identifiant attribu l'ordre par le prestataire de soins ou l'organisation qui reoit la demande de service. Il s'agit galement du numro d'identification de la commande de l'excutant.
C'est l'quivalent du numro de commande du remplisseur dans les spcifications HL7 v2.
Informations sur le prestataire ou l'organisme de soins de sant qui reoit la demande de service.
Le codage avec une terminologie est prfrable, dans la mesure du possible.
La date et/ou l'heure laquelle l'ensemble de la procdure, ou le dernier lment d'une procdure plusieurs composantes, a t termin.

A utiliser uniquement en association avec l'tape "Procdure effectue", et dans les situations o la procdure est rpte plusieurs reprises avant d'tre termine ou lorsque la procdure comporte plusieurs lments. Cet attribut peut tre le mme que l'attribut de temps RM pour l'tape "Procdure termine".
La dure totale de la procdure, qui peut inclure le temps pass pendant la phase active de la procdure plus le temps pendant lequel la procdure a t suspendue.
A utiliser uniquement en association avec les tapes du parcours "Procdure termine".
Identification du site du corps pour la procdure.

Les occurrences de cet lment de donnes ne sont pas limites pour permettre des scnarios cliniques tels que l'limination de multiples lsions cutanes diffrents endroits, mais o tous les autres attributs sont identiques. Utilisez cet lment de donnes pour enregistrer des termes simples ou des emplacements anatomiques prcoordonns. Si les besoins d'enregistrement de l'emplacement anatomique sont dtermins au moment de l'excution par l'application ou ncessitent une modlisation plus complexe telle que les emplacements relatifs, utilisez alors le fichier CLUSTER.anatomical_location ou CLUSTER.relative_location dans l'espace "dtail de la procdure" de cet archtype. Si l'emplacement anatomique est inclus dans le "Nom de la procdure" via des codes prcoordonns, cet lment de donnes devient redondant.
Informations supplmentaires requises pour saisir le contenu local ou pour s'aligner sur d'autres modles/formalismes de rfrence.
Par exemple : exigences locales en matire d'information ou mtadonnes supplmentaires aligner avec les quivalents FHIR ou CIMI.
Identification de la mthode ou de la technique spcifique pour la procdure.

Utilisez cet lment de donnes pour enregistrer des termes simples ou une description narrative. Si les exigences d'enregistrement de la mthode ncessitent une modlisation plus complexe, celle-ci peut tre reprsente par des archtypes supplmentaires dans l'espace "dtail de la procdure" de cet archtype. Si la mthode est incluse dans le "Nom de la procdure" via des codes prcoordonns, cet lment d'information devient redondant.
La date et/ou l'heure laquelle la procdure est cense tre excute.
A utiliser uniquement en association avec l'tape "Procdure prvue".
Cet lment de donnes pragmatique peut tre utilis pour soutenir l'organisation au sein de l'interface utilisateur.
La procdure, ou la sous-procdure dans une procdure plusieurs composantes, a t lance.
Les difficults ou problmes rencontrs lors de l'excution de la procdure.
Exemples : Le patient tait agit, la vidange de l'estomac tait insuffisante avant la gastroscopie, une tumeur dans les voies biliaires rendait impossible le passage du scope.

Par exemple : les exigences en matire d'information locale ou les mtadonnes supplmentaires aligner sur les quivalents FHIR ou CIMI : Appareils auditifs assists, lunettes, lentilles de contact, appareils dentaires, dentiers, orthses ou membres artificiels.

Indiquer si la rponse est complte

En cas d'valuation pathologique : une rponse complte pathologique est dfinie comme l'absence de preuve de cancer invasif rsiduel de l'chantillon complet rsqu et de tous les ganglions lymphatiques rgionaux prlevs. En cas d'valuation diagnostique uniquement : une rponse clinique complte est dfinie lorsqu'il n'y a pas de signe de tumeur aprs tous les tests diagnostiques (par exemple, IRM/endoscopie).

Le type de marge est dcrit, par exemple : marge profonde, marge vasculaire, marge bronchique.
L'emplacement de la marge est dcrit.
La nature de l'envahissement tumoral au niveau de la marge chirurgicale.
